articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Saudi Aramco hits new low since trading began on December 11
articles.description: Saudi Aramco <2222.SE> shares briefly hit 34.45 riyals ($9.18) in early trade, their lowest level since its shares began trading on December 11, following a record-setting initial public offering (IPO).
articles.content:
DUBAI (Reuters) - Saudi Aramco (2222.SE) shares briefly hit 34.45 riyals ($9.18) in early trade, their lowest level since its shares began trading on December 11, following a record-setting initial public offering (IPO). 
At 0706 GMT, Aramco shares were down… [+262 chars]

articles.author: Babak Dehghanpisheh and Jeff Mason
articles.title: Huge crowds in Iran for commander's funeral, daughter warns U.S. of 'dark day'
articles.description: Tens of thousands of Iranians thronged the streets of Tehran on Monday for the funeral of Quds Force commander Qassem Soleimani who was killed in a U.S. air strike last week and his daughter said his death would bring a "dark day" for the United States.
articles.content: DUBAI/WASHINGTON (Reuters) - Tens of thousands of Iranians thronged the streets of Tehran on Monday for the funeral of Quds Force commander Qassem Soleimani who was killed in a U.S. air strike last week and his daughter said his death would bring a “dark day”… [+4380 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Australia beat New Zealand by 279 runs for 3-0 series sweep
articles.description: Australia beat New Zealand by 279 runs with more than a day to spare in the third and final test at the Sydney Cricket Ground on Monday, to sweep the series 3-0.
articles.content:
SYDNEY (Reuters) - Australia beat New Zealand by 279 runs with more than a day to spare in the third and final test at the Sydney Cricket Ground on Monday, to sweep the series 3-0. 
The hosts declared on 217 for two after lunch to hand the Black Caps an unli… [+147 chars]

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Sanctions threat against Iraq 'not very helpful', German minister says
articles.description: Threatening Iraq with sanctions is "not very helpful," Germany's foreign minister said on Monday, after U.S. President Donald Trump warned that Baghdad could be hit by sanctions "like they've never seen before" if U.S. forces were forced to leave.
articles.content: BERLIN (Reuters) - Threatening Iraq with sanctions is “not very helpful,” Germany’s foreign minister said on Monday, after U.S. President Donald Trump warned that Baghdad could be hit by sanctions “like they’ve never seen before” if U.S. forces were forced to… [+493 chars]

articles.title: Koala mittens and joey pouches: Australian bushfires spark global knitting frenzy
articles.description: Knitting needles are clicking furiously around the world to create hundreds of protective pouches and blankets for native wildlife made homeless by Australian wildfires that have razed large swathes of bushland.
articles.content:

articles.author: Reuters Editorial
articles.title: Mexico asks for restraint in Iraq, Iran
articles.description: Mexico said on Sunday that it was concerned about the recent events in Iraq and Iran and asked all parties involved to act with restraint and avoid escalating regional tensions.
articles.content:
MEXICO CITY (Reuters) - Mexico said on Sunday that it was concerned about the recent events in Iraq and Iran and asked all parties involved to act with restraint and avoid escalating regional tensions.

articles.title: Nikkei starts 2020 with broad selloff on rising U.S.-Iran tensions
articles.description: Japan's Nikkei share average fell to a one-month low on Monday as selloff gripped the market on the first trading day of 2020 on fears of an escalation in U.S-Iran tensions.

articles.title: Absent Russell Crowe uses Golden Globes win to highlight Australia bushfire crisis
